thread.title: Zambia: 'Super' Dora Gets Energy Role

title: Zambia: 'Super' Dora Gets Energy Role
text:
Zambia: Simuusa Fights for PF Adoption in Wake of Rejection By Peter Adamu The flamboyant Patriotic Front Petauke Central Member of Parliament Dora Siliya was this afternoon unveiled as Energy Minister. Formerly of the MMD as spokesperson and chief government mouthpiece, Siliya bounces back following a torturing political career that landed her through a rigorous court process for alleged abuse of authority, charges alleged instigated by her foes whom she once referred to as "little men with little brains." Today, the former ZNBC newscaster bounced back into mainstream government operations with an appoint as energy minister at a critical time when the country is facing power deficit. Siliya told journalist it was humbling to bounce back; "My family and I are deeply humbled by the confidence by the Head of State in giving me this opportunity to serve the Zambian people. We are peace loving citizens and with our collective efforts, we will ensure we attend to the problems facing the energy sector." The charismatic politician was sworn in alongside Lawrence Evans who is Deputy Minister of Livestock and Fisheries. Zambia
